text: Hi, do you know how to create a hubl date variable that is local_dt + 9 days?
<@U25C65C3S> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25C65C3S/FAALJKCH5/-.py|Untitled>
:point_up: this concept but just thought that it could cause issue as the date wouldn't push to the next month, would need to add some extra logic to make the days no more than 31
<!here> anyone else having issues with HubSpot loading hubdb or design manager?
<@U25C65C3S> yes, I just found that to be the issue.
<@U25C65C3S> have you used "step" from here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/reference>
The non beta version of the design manager is loading fine for me
So in that case you could take the local_dt| int and + 777600000
<@U7D5W6EVA>
<@U25C65C3S> thanks man, let me try that. Appreciate the help. 10 years in c#.net and HubL is defeating me. :disappointed:
no problem "unlearning" :joy:
testing it, doesn't look like it worked for me.
Same. :disappointed:
<@U25C65C3S> et al see <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/msnfdlvc4hxv>
This seems to save without error, but doesnt render:
{{ local_dt|step(60000) }}
Anyone else see issues with responsiveness in emails at the lowest screen breakpoint? New emails in the new editor are pushed out of the sides for me
Which new editor are you referring to? The new email beta?

I believe it’s stemming from design manager beta - it’s a newly designed email, so I don’t know that it would have worked the same in the old one, but the appearance on mobile and resized screens doesn’t seem to be “responsive” similar to the other breakpoints
It actually looks like its td.columnContent widget-span widget-type-custom_widget that’s messing it up
<@U22PNRAJD>
I had a similar issue and had to move to coded HTML
No, it’s when you group a few elements - if you move them out of the group it doesn’t break at <400 (380) screen width
The new Shopify addon is so good
Having used <http://Hubshop.ly|Hubshop.ly> and Revenue Conduit, this is a great addition
